intro: Sirmuellera dentata, commonly known as the toothed sirmuellera, is a flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae and is characterized by its basal rosette of narrow, toothed leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or white, blooming in spring. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in alpine or subalpine habitats. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and specialized species.
